node.text:
Last spring, I had the opportunity to help some neighbors around the Grand Canyon. On the heels of raising $48k — thanks to you all — via a print sale to aid native tribes struggling with Covid challenges, we were able to do a direct delivery of PPE to communities that needed it. With the help of volunteer pilots from @ecoflight and a donation from the Catena Foundation that acquired the PPE, we flew a 1/4 million masks, gloves, goggles and hand sanitizer from a local distillery to the remote communities of Navajo, Hopi, Southern Ute, and Zuni who weren’t getting protective equipment in a timely manner or at all. ⁣
⁣
This was a small gesture, but a profoundly moving one. It felt good to give back to those that gave so much to me during my end-to-end Grand Canyon journey. Thanks @goodkarmafilms for the edit and to all those who made this possible.⁣
⁣
#neighbors #volunteerism #native 🎥 by #petemcbride on #sonyalpha

node.text:
I'm honored to work with the team at @sonyalpha as they continue to innovate and expand the limits of our storytelling tools with the launch of the new Sony α1 camera. See the magic for yourself in this beautiful film.⁣
⁣
Directed by @curtismorgan and featuring @edsel @keshalambert @mitty @charlysavely @phil.yoon @paulnicklen and more #BeAlpha #SonyAlpha

node.text: In my photographic and film journey chasing rivers and other wild realms, the camera started as a key for adventure — but it evolved into a tool to protect the places where we adventure. Enjoy this short #passporthome about my work and see the link in my bio for more. Thx @sonyalpha and @polarpro 🎥 by Pete McBride with additional footage by my friend @skiparmstrong. #sonyalpha #polarpro #shortfilm #nature #wildlife

node.text: Source to sea: @mountainworld and I once took a trip down the length of the revered and reviled Ganges River in India for a @natgeo assignment. 1500 river-miles later, we'd seen why this incredible source of sustenance is so sacred - and life-sustaining - to so many. Our film "Holy (un)Holy River" is now available to stream on Amazon Prime - link in bio to watch. #Ganges #HolyunHolyRiver #India #rivers

node.title: Ganges Source to Sea: Holy (un)Holy River Trailer

node.text: We may feel divided. But there’s one thing we all share — a common ground — the amazing wild lands we all share in this country.  Let’s help protect them by making a plan to vote this fall.  Democracy is about who shows up. Thanks my friend @jimmychin for your voice and @protectourwinters. See link in bio to learn more. #vote  #commonground

node.text: Some good news from the mountains of Kenya. The locally owned, grassroots Retete Elephant orphanage @R.E.S.C.U.E recently released four orphans successfully back into the wild proving how community conservation models can work, not only for saving wildlife, but also creating jobs.  This is a short film I did about these conservation heroes, many of them Samburu women, for @nrt_kenya @usaid. Thanks to all  behind this challenging work and seeing it succeed. #elephants #wildlife #kenya #conservation #nature #happyFriday Video by #petemcbride with #davidmclain.

node.text:
If the virus could talk, this is what it might say. This video message from COVID-19 to humankind is an important reminder of how closely connected we are to all life on Earth. We are learning to live with a new normal, but what comes after COVID-19? We can’t stop pandemics if we don’t stop the cause, which is why it’s time to make our voices heard and demand that #ExtinctionEndsHere -- for all life on Earth. 
Take action: ExtinctionEndsHere.org

Video from @global_wildlife_conservation
and @SeaLegacy. #covid19 
A powerfully done video by some colleagues on the eve of #earthday.

node.text: While we may be physically apart, we can all still connect and share. A few words from the @sonyalpha family. I feel very proud to be a part of this community of visual creatives, many of which are dear friends and all are using their work to inspire and support each other and the planet during these challenging times. @Sony also amazingly just donated $100 million dollars for Covid-19 relief. Grateful for dedication and care.  #SonyAlpha #covid19 #corona #hope #positive #stayhome #stayhealthy  @kaylalindquist @chrisburkard @ben_moon @renan_ozturk @taylorfreesolo @paulnicklen @chrisorwig @mitty @benlowy @mparns @Andy_mann @briansmithphoto @brookeshaden @carolinej @Katrin_eismann @irablockphoto @sonyalpha @miguelquilesjr @sarafrance @merakoh @mclain.david @keshalambert @tobishinobi @littlecoal @davidburnettfoto  and many more.

node.text: Community Conservation: Last year I had the privilege of working with @nrt_kenya and @usaid to highlight how northern Kenya has battled wildlife poaching with conservation models that promote peace, security, steady jobs and entrepreneurial options for women — creating better long term economics across 42,000 square kms and 18 ethnic groups in 39 conservancies than the short term lure of illegal poaching. #kenya #conservation #wildlife #nature #Africa 🎥 @mclain.david #petemcbride

node.text: I recently had the privilege to film a day in the life of Nkiliyan, a “Star Beader” with @beadworksKenya who is improving her life, community, and corner of her world—one bead at a time. Nkiliyan is using her Samburu traditions and entrepreneurial skills to sell her jewelry from Kenya to Australia and even my home in Colorado. Thanks to her organization of the women in her village to participate, many children in the area are now able to attend school, creating economic diversity and alternatives to livestock. Illegal poaching has since dropped and wildlife has flourished, enabling peace and even pockets of ecotourism. A win-win for all in what was a war-torn region. It is amazing to see how one person can create a ripple of positive change through community conservation. Thx @nrt_kenya @usaid @mclain.david @bsargeant90 @soiyagecaga #africa #kenya #wildlife

node.text: Get ready for the #YouthClimateStrike with a new experimental animated short by @AmplifierArt - SOUND ON 🔊 Like a lot of kids @HawkeyeHuey is hearing about #ClimateChange and the #ClimateCrisis we are facing, and it's freaking him out! He - and every other child - has the right to a safe environment. This collaboration with @Bemo_Studio demands #ClimateAction from our politicians. TOMORROW we are going on strike in solidarity with students around the world. Is your class ready? Are your kids walking out?  Support the movement by registering at strikewithus.org and joining the strike! #strikewithus #amplifierart #FridaysforFuture

node.text:
Just 7 days left to purchase a photograph for @printsforwildlife and support Africa’s wild places during a time of critical need. Here is a small selection of images from the 170 photographers that donated work.  100% of the proceeds (after printing & handling) go to @africanparksnetwork to protect wildlife and provide benefits to local communities during the pandemic. Visit printsforwildlife.org to buy yours today (link in bio). Sale ends Aug. 11. I am proud to join so many of my colleagues to support this effort. Photos by @beverlyjoubert @andyparkinsonphoto @amivitale @stevewinterphoto @pedrombride @Steve_woods_photography @gucharan @drewdoggettphotography 

#conservation #printsale #cuteanimals #wildlife

node.text:
Can the color of snow predict the future on water supply? This summer I worked on a project documenting our changing weather patterns and water supply in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado and beyond. I was amazed at how skinny the snowpack was up high, but also at how it was blanketed in tea-colored layers of dust, all blown in from the southwest where more development and activity have disturbed fragile desert ecosystems and soils. This new dust phenomenon captures the heat of the sun, melting off the snow more quickly and greatly affecting the predictability and quantity of one of our most important natural resource supplies: water.

The results of such climate weirdness are now being seen and felt in every corner of our shared world — even pristine, Rocky Mountain wildernesses at 14,000 feet. We all, myself included, need to find more ways to reduce our carbon footprints. How we eat and travel are two areas we can do that. A third, which we tend to overlook, is how we personally invest and save our money. I’m proud to bank and partner with @bankofthewest because they are a leader in sustainable banking, with policies that restrict the financing of activities that are harmful to the environment. 

#water #climate #environment #sponsored

node.text: Congrats to my longtime friend @jimmychin on your first photography book #ThereandBack — which is now available for pre-order and Publishing everywhere on November 16. The book spans 20 years of Jimmy's portfolio, including imagery captured from expeditions across 7 continents. More info at the link in my bio.  Seems like yesterday we were scrambling up the Tetons together Jimmy - congrats.  #friends #adventure #expedition #photography 📷 by #jimmychin

node.text: Hooray for the Little Things: The Little Colorado River is a tributary inside the Grand Canyon which naturally flows turquoise due to the calcium carbonate rich waters. This marvel has been a regular target for developments, from gondolas to dams, to turn its beauty into cash. The latest have been three dam proposals inside this remote canyon considered to be a spiritual center by the Navajo and Hopi tribes (and others). But today, the developer cancelled two of the proposals. One remains — and an uphill paddle to prevent it — but right now we have some good news to celebrate for this little yet powerful river. To learn more or get involved, check out @grandcanyontrust #GrandCanyon #Hopi #Navajo #conservation 📸 by #PeteMcBride 1, 2 #confluence  3 - inside the upper LCR

node.text: Summer Skies — Nothing I love more than seeing the sweep of starlight on a high moutain during calm nights - even if it requires 3 am wake ups.  An outtake from my new book #SeeingSilence #milky-way #starlight #wilderness 📷 #petemcbride

I am thrilled to share the new short film "Shaba" by my good friend @amivitale. (Sound on). The film tells the extraordinary story of Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e)'s first matriarch. The film is now online and your ticket sales will go directly to support the elephants and their incredible keepers. It is available on-demand from today until August 31. Visit shabafilm.org or click on the link in my profile to watch today. 📷 @amivitali
 
@sararafoundation @conservationorg @kenyawildlifeservice @nrt_kenya @tusk_org @sandiegozoo @thephotosociety @passionplanet #shabafilm #shaba #retetielephants  #DontLetThemDisappear #elephants #saveelephants #stoppoaching #kenya #natureisspeaking #conservation

node.text: My buddy @PaulNicklen is a remarkable wildlife photographer and today he is celebrating a birthday.  All he wants is for us to help him save the ocean. We can help by joining  The Tide through the link in my bio to further @SeaLegacy’s conservation mission. As a thank you, Paul is also giving away his own @Zodiacwatches to one lucky winner! Happy Birthday ya ol’ goat Paulinus. Keep up the good work.  #polarbear #wildlife #ocean #conservation

node.text:
I'm honored to be a part of @printsforwildlife, a print fundraiser featuring more than 150+ photographers to support conservation efforts in Africa. 100% of the proceeds (after printing and handling) will be donated to @africanparksnetwork so that they can continue to protect wildlife and deliver benefits to local communities during the COVID-19 pandemic, which is still having a devastating impact on protected areas. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Each print is $100 USD and is printed on Hahnemuhle Natural Line Hemp fine-art paper, 30x45cm with a 1cm border. The fundraiser is open until August 11th, so see the full range of prints and pick up one now for yourself or a friend by heading to @printsforwildlife or printsforwildlife.org. #fundraiser #Africa #fineart #wildlife⁣ #conservation #nature ⁣
⁣⁣
📷: 1. Lions by @pedromcbride 2. Elephants by @beverlyjoubert 3. Rays by @erinoutdoors 4. Leopard by @stevewinterphoto 5. Swordfish by @karimiliya

node.text:
Dust on Snow: My latest work for @natgeo looks at how snowfields across the Rockies have become more colorful lately as dust storms shower them. The tea-colored snow doesn’t just mar scenic views, but acts like a blanket on the snowpack, absorbing heat from the sun and melting the snow more quickly and up to six weeks earlier.

Forty million people in the Colorado River Basin rely on sustained snowpack for drinking water and to irrigate 5.5 million acres of agricultural land.  The American Southwest is enduring the twenty-second year of the worst drought in about 500 years. The intense and widespread dry spell defies historical records and leaves meteorologists and water managers at a loss for how to predict the future. Scientists argue that the West is now experiencing “aridification”—a permanent transition to an “increasingly water scarce environment.” To see the article, check the link in my bio. 

#environment #climatechange #nature #water #drought #megadrought #ColoradoRiver #Aerial #sonyalpha 📷 by #PeteMcBride  #aerial with @ecoflight skier @wanderingadult  #scientist Jeff Derry
